definition: to recruit/to provoke/to beckon/to incur/to infect/contagious/a move (chess)/a maneuver/device/trick/to confess

sentences.english: Its movements imitated the motion of five kinds of birds and beasts.
sentences.chinese: 其招式就模仿了五种飞禽走兽的动作。

sentences.english: I don't know if I can do all of those moves.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道我能不能把那些招式都比划出来。

sentences.english: Let me show you something new.
sentences.chinese: 让我给你展示些新招式。

sentences.english: You can learn about the taichi knowledge and forms.
sentences.chinese: 你可以了解到太极的知识和招式。

sentences.english: Instructor, how did I win the tournament with only one move?
sentences.chinese: 锻练，为什么我用一个招式就赢得了这场比赛？

sentences.english: Many styles of Kung Fu are based on the ideas of nature.
sentences.chinese: 很多功夫招式来源于对自然界的想象。

sentences.english: Practise martial arts person has to need to have skill , then it is possible let self move style have antipersonnel force.
sentences.chinese: 习武者必须要具备功力才能使自己的招式有杀伤力。

sentences.english: Fighting games are almost nothing but a series of moves.
sentences.chinese: 格斗类游戏就是一系列的招式组成的。

sentences.english: Hands and feet naturalized basaltic, which means Yin and Yang Yun dynamic moves.
sentences.chinese: 手脚自然化玄武，意动招式蕴阴阳。

sentences.english: Suitable for the connection in the left swing after the move is right inverse pendulum and the right leg whip.
sentences.chinese: 适合接在左摆拳之后的招式是右反摆和右鞭腿。

definition: move (in chess, on stage, in martial arts)/gambit/trick/scheme/movement/same as 著數|着数[zhao1 shu4]
pose or motion of one's body in martial arts
Wugong County in Xianyang 咸陽|咸阳[Xian2 yang2], Shaanxi
martial art/military accomplishments/(Peking opera) martial arts feats
to make a move (in martial arts or figuratively)
unique skill/unexpected tricky move (as a last resort)/masterstroke/finishing blow
to use fully/to put to use
